data.title: Crash after “Open With...”
data.body: Control+click “Open With...” menu showed two versions of Atom.app: 1.0.0 and 1.0.2. Selecting 1.0.2 lead to the editor crashing.

data.title: Handle more open/save error codes with custom notifications
data.body:
Adds several more codes to the handling of read/write errors that have been reported via notifications.
### Open
- [x] `EIO`
- [x] `ENOTCONN`
- [x] `ENXIO`
- [x] `UNKNOWN`
### Save
- [x] `EINTR`
- [x] `EIO`
- [x] `ENOTSUP`
- [x] `ESPIPE`

Refs #2539
Closes #4467
Closes #6348
Closes #6799
Closes #7203
Refs #7649
Closes #7651
Closes #7654
Closes #7780
Closes https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/412

data.title: Atom (linter-pylint?) bogging down CPU with spike of Python processes
data.body:
Hello,

I've got a large (~500 line) script that I'm writing that just comes to a _crawl_ whenever I'm typing. I've watched the task monitor and determined it's a spike in Python processes that have a high cycle usage. This problem becomes worse for the duration of typing and then resolves itself slowly over the next few minutes. It's quite frustrating, but I can't be sure if this is the way Atom's handling it or an issue with PyLint or what?

Here's the task manager prior to typing in the file:

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2992409/8580970/a7200d98-258b-11e5-88f7-d36cc76c02d8.png)
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2992409/8580971/a722f544-258b-11e5-8d5a-60b874d71548.png)

Here they are shortly after typing a block of text with multiple lines:

![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2992409/8581007/ed50f854-258b-11e5-9236-c98c66dee5a6.png)
![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2992409/8581006/ed4df58c-258b-11e5-8a25-8058fb221596.png)

I'm not sure what else to make of it. If this isn't an ATOM Issue, does anyone have an idea what it might be?

Thanks!

data.title: Version control modification counter causes overlapping text on the bottom toolbar
data.body: Here is what my bottom toolbar looks like when a file with no modifications is open: But when I open a file with modified lines and the version control modification widget is displayed, it looks like this: I did the same test with the linter package disabled, it is not caused by that plugin. This is on Atom 1.0 running on OS X.

data.title: Autocomplete attempts to add CSS property after commas
data.body:
See small screencast - http://cl.ly/3V1R3d0r1F3v

Mac OSX 10.10.4 - Atom 1.0.1 - No errors / crashes.

I've noticed when attempting to chain CSS selectors (in SCSS) the autocomplete pop-up will appear after I've typed the comma, meaning when I try to hit Return to go to the next line, I get width: width; instead of a new line.

I changed my settings from autocomplete on Tab to autocomplete on Enter after installing Emmet so it's well within my capabilities to circumvent the issue currently but curious as to why it pulls up this prompt when typing commas in CSS (SCSS)?

data.title: Add code of conduct to contributing guidelines
data.body:
I have discussed this with @atom/core and they intend to adopt and uphold this code of conduct. It will apply to all repositories in the [@atom GitHub organization](https://github.com/atom), the [discussion forum](https://discuss.atom.io/), and [chat rooms](http://atom-slack.herokuapp.com/).

A blog post on atom.io will be coming soon about it.

data.title: Support for keymap text in context menu
data.body: If you have a keymap for a specific action and that action is used in a context menu, I would like the keymap to display right-justified on the context menu entry. This seems to work for file menu items, just not context menu items.

data.title: `BufferedProcess` doesn't yield an error running a not existing command on Windows
data.body:
According to this [spec](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/spec/buffered-process-spec.coffee#L15-L31) `BufferedProcess` should call the handler defined using `onWillThrowError` if the spawned command doesn't exist. However, this is not the case on my Windows box.

Since the command is spawned in a sub-shell `cmd.exe` (which is an aweful default setup, this should be optional), the handler is never called but the default error message of `cmd.exe` is logged on `stderr` and the process (in this case `cmd.exe`) exits with status code `1`. This means the above mentioned spec should fail running on Windows, which seems to me like a bug in `BufferedProcess`.

data.title: Not able to install atom on windows 8.1
data.body: ![screenshot 5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3994657/8573844/8a057948-2548-11e5-91d3-cd0069a06a18.png)

data.title: Weight Capitol Letters More in Fuzzy Search
data.body: It seems that Sublime and possibly the chrome dev tools give a higher priority to capitol letters when searching. This makes finding the file `MyFileName.ext` much easier since you can type `MFN` and not be bothered with having to spell it out. I think this is a great productivity feature since with current atom, i have to try to spell out the file the way it is which introduces many more errors.

data.title: minify js files cause lag and results in crash of atom
data.body:
Operating System: OS X 10.10.02 
Atom Version: 1.0.0

Steps to reproduce: Open a minified js file of your choice (If your cool choose a large one)

Atom Responds after a while:  Editor is not responding Dialog

data.title: only keep tab open if editing
data.body: One of the things I liked about sublime is that you can click around files in the sidebar without accumulating a ton of tabs. This is especially helpful if you're looking for something and are not quite sure where it might be. Unless you double click the file in the left pane or start editing the file, it closes it when you click another file. Almost like a quick preview, sort of. Is this functionality built in or might there be a package for this?

data.title: Suppress display of end-of-file newlines as blank lines
data.body: Atom by default inserts a new line (a line break actually) at the end of file (and it's cool), but it also shows this newline as an empty line at the end of file, but it's prefereably don't do this. How can I fix this? Thank you very much.

data.title: Opening single file when Atom is not open – existing projects and open files are closed/removed
data.body:
1. Have some project folders in the sidebar and some open files. When you start Atom by itself, these are always restored.
2. Close Atom
3. Open a single txt file

**Expected:** The project folders and open files from last time are restored, and the new single file is open in a new, now focused tab. Exactly what happens when you open a single file while Atom is already open.

**What actually happens:** The project folders are wiped, as are the open files. The sidebar just shows the parent folder tree of the newly opened file, and only a single tab for said file.

data.title: Auto detect as file encoding
data.body:
Auto detect is powerful, Why use UTF8 as default reading format?
And I hope I can convert file encoding.

data.title: Fuzzy finder should prefer changed files when other factors are equal
data.body:
When searching for a file, fuzzy finder returns a list of suggestions.
When all factors from 2 files match, fuzzy finder should always return the file with recent edits/uncommited changes first.

data.title: Fuzzy file finder should prefer direct match
data.body: currently it is not. When searching for "usa_spec", it first suggests 'user_search_spec.rb' and only after the 'usa_spec.rb'. It should be the other way around, IMO. OSX 10.10.4, Atom 1.0.0

data.title: Follow symlinks in projects
data.body:
There's a unexpected behaviour with folders that are symlinked into the project folder.

The editor does provide the full path to the file instead of following the symlinks.
This will cause issues with the linter plugin.

Here's an example:
I've got a project which contains three symlinks to other folders with my code, some files like the coffeelint.json are static files in the project.

![screen shot 2015-07-08 at 09 18 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1727958/8565071/6108cd7e-2552-11e5-9de0-9c3fafb7e17f.png)

The provided path of the main.coffee looks like this:

```
/Volumes/faxe/local/henne/fileadmin/templates/page/scripts/main.coffee
```

But it should look like this

```
/Volumes/faxe/projects/henne/page/scripts/main.coffee
```

Because of this the linter plugin won't work as expected, see here: https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-coffeelint/issues/43

data.title: Running Atom inside a browser
data.body:
Since Atom is based on the web stack; is there a way it can be run inside a browser tab?

I am on a Chromebook and would love to be able to use Atom in a tab (or in a standalone window if possible)

Crouton is a solution to boot into a more traditional Linux environment; but it's really not an elegant solution. 

Thanks!

data.title: Suppress line measurement exceptions and gather data to solve them
data.body: This code recovers gracefully from situations where we try to measure off the end of a text node. Since this situation is unexpected, when it happens, we ask the user (only once) for the text of the line where it's happening. Hopefully we can use this information to get a better understanding of why this is happening.

data.title: Atom Freezes (becomes unresponsive) with large text file
data.body:
I installed Atom on a Windows 7 PC with 16gb of RAM (64-bit OS) and attempted to open up a 8mb text file.

The program stalled and could not open the file.

I was able to open up the same document using Notepad++ without issue.

I have, for the moment, removed the program until this issue is resolved.
## Thanks,

Michael Frankel
President & CEO, Wizard Consulting Group, Inc.
